main event: A bright silver-like object was observed flying at a very high altitude over the Four Corners area of Colorado on October 10, 1951.
interesting points: The object was observed for 35 minutes by several persons, including an experienced pilot.
The object maintained a straight course and showed no deviation from its flight path.
A second observation on October 30, 1951 described a white and luminous object shaped like an ellipse or meteor, surrounded by a blue glow.
The object on October 30 disappeared as suddenly as it appeared.
A third observation on October 30, 1951 described a tight pattern of three objects hovering and then descending with a green tint before disappearing.
sighted object: Bright silver-like object, white and luminous object, tight pattern of three objects
